file_content.text: Move along, move along. The Republic's work is never done.
Damn politicians are turning everyone soft! Letting criminals go free! It'll be the end of the Republic.
Heh heh. I heard our pirate friend had a little accident trying to escape the separatists' base. Our pal Phipps's face turned purple when he heard the news.
Brilliant, brilliant work there.
He was clearly trouble, regardless of what he knew.
He was dangerous.
Well, he's no trouble now, thanks to you.
Soon as I met the guy, I said to myself, "This can only end one way."
He was a jerk.
Well, I'm glad it did.
It was nothing.
Hey, listen, just don't go bragging publicly about this. It's supposed to be an accident, remember?
Hand over the reward and stop bothering me.
You promised payment.
You get right to the point, don't you? Fine, fine.
Here's your reward. Consider it fair compensation for your "service" to the Republic. And remember, this is our little secret.
Move along.
Ah, great. So that blasted bureaucrat Milo finally found someone naive enough to want to free that damn pirate, Veem Set.
He said you'd give me the details.
Fill me in.
Yeah, that's my job. But it doesn't mean I like it, and it doesn't mean I won't try to persuade you otherwise.
It's my duty to help the Republic.
Just doing my job.
Listen, soldier--I've been serving on this forsaken planet since the war started, so don't tell me it's your duty to kiss up to some slobbering idiot from Coruscant.
I have no love of pirates, but the enemy of my enemy is my friend, you know what I'm saying?
I hate the separatists.
And what about pirates who align themselves with separatists?
I'm getting paid.
Seems everyone on Ord Mantell has a price.
Veem Set is filth--bloodthirsty, ruthless filth. And he's a war criminal. His ships have been screwing up Republic supply routes for years--countless people have died because of him.
He took out my brother's battle cruiser, killed thousands more. The Republic should be planting his head on a stake, not offering him protection.
If he can help us crush the separatists, he's worth sparing.
What if he's useful?
You want to crush the separatists? Don't let no-count criminals get away with running guns for them and shooting down Republic ships.
When you put it that way, I see your point. Didn't realize this guy was a murderer.
I guess you're right.
You're starting to talk sense, then. But there's a simple enough solution.
And?
If you free this bloodthirsty pirate, what's to stop anyone from thinking they can attack Republic ships and just beg for mercy later?
The Republic knows this is a difficult mission--they won't be surprised if there's a little slip, a little accident.
And since, you know, I'm in charge of payroll here, I could throw in a nice, healthy sum to sweeten the deal--if you, say, "accidentally" killed this pirate.
What you're suggesting is murder, and you're lucky I don't report you for even suggesting it.
That's wrong.
This is war, and that pirate is the enemy. That's not murder.
I like this.
I won't betray the Republic, and I don't like you asking me to.
I'm not a traitor.
Betray the Republic! You'll be serving it, and you'll be fairly compensated.
Is that a bribe?
Credits, huh?
I prefer to think of it as fair payment for eliminating an enemy of the Republic.
So you gonna kill him or what?
This galaxy could use one less pirate.
Pirates are scum.
Damn right. And the Republic could use one less enemy.
I have a duty to the Republic.
I won't disobey orders.
Yes, and that duty is to eliminate the enemies of the Republic, and this pirate is one of them.
Sure.
I hope so. Remember--I don't care how you do it, just make it seem like an accident.
Absolutely not.
Suit yourself. Maybe you'll have a change of heart when you meet the son of a sow. Damn pirates.
The pirate's being kept in a holding cell in the separatists' base. You'll have to figure out the rest.
I get the feeling you'll know what to do when you get there. Good luck.
No loitering. This is a designated watch zone. Move along.
